ask.01: This channel is the only official way for urgent cases. Please share your key now ‚Äì there's no time for bureaucracy!

redFlags.asksForKey: Real support never asks for your Secret Key
redFlags.urgency: Artificial time pressure is a classic manipulation tactic
redFlags.noVerification: No reference to official channels or website
redFlags.accountSuspension: Account suspension without official email or app notification

fakeSupport01.explanation: The Secret Key is like a private vault key: whoever knows it has full access to your entire balance. No legitimate service ‚Äì not even Stellar itself ‚Äì will ever ask for it. Never share it with anyone, no matter how urgent the request sounds or how official the sender appears.

fakeWebsite01.explanation: No legitimate tool, website, or service ever needs your Secret Key. Entering it gives the operator full access to your account. Being specifically targeted and fake reviews are classic tactics to build false trust.

redFlags.sendToReceive: Sending crypto to receive more is ALWAYS a scam
redFlags.noSource: No official source can be linked

fakeAirdrop01.explanation: The 'send-to-receive' pattern is one of the oldest crypto scams. Anyone who sends crypto gets nothing back ‚Äì blockchain transactions are irreversible. Official airdrops never require you to send anything first.

romanceScam01.explanation: Romance scams build trust over weeks or months before asking for money. The victim feels emotionally obligated to help. No camera, no video calls, always an emergency ‚Äì these are reliable warning signs.
